CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Delivered to End Users stage positioned above or below the Post-Distribution stage?
SRP.A: The Delivered to End Users stage is positioned {below} the Post-Distribution stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Paid Consumption?
VE.A: The value of stage Paid Consumption is {9620}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Transmission?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Transmission is {37812}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Total Energy Generated, with a value of {86841}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Paid Consumption, with a value of {9620}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission?
SC.A: Decreased by {18095} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 71374? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 13091? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Billed Consumption} stage has {11168}, the {Paid Consumption} stage has {9620}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 13091 and 31393? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Distribution} stage has {24974}, the {Delivered to End Users} stage has {15015}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Billed Consumption to Paid Consumption, or from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Total Energy Generated} to {Post-Generation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Billed Consumption to Paid Consumption, or from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Transmission} to {Post-Distribution} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users, from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission, or from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to stage {Post-Transmission} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Total Energy Generated} and {Post-Generation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Billed Consumption} and {Paid Consumption} stages.
